underlying_goal: To create a tool (as a Claude agent) to monitor API usage and credit balance across multiple LLM providers.
friction_detail: Initial implementation ran into API issues: an OpenRouter endpoint didn't exist as assumed, and the OpenAI key lacked permissions for the chosen endpoint. Claude debugged these, discovering the API limitations and adapting the script. A background agent also failed with an unrelated error.
primary_success: Claude successfully designed, built, and debugged a multi-provider billing agent from scratch. This involved researching provider APIs, handling different authentication requirements and data availability, writing a Python script with rich terminal output, and wrapping it in a Claude agent.
brief_summary: The user requested an agent to check LLM billing. Claude researched the APIs for OpenAI, OpenRouter, and Anthropic, then designed and built a Python script and agent. After debugging API permission issues and limitations, Claude refined the script, added support for HuggingFace, and used code-simplifier and code-reviewer agents to improve the code before committing the final tool.
